result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Orlando Santiago

records.addlTxt: Status conference scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Orlando Santiago in court, in custody.  Attorney Alexander J. Kostal in court for Orlando Santiago.  Attorney Alicia Kort, appearing for Jack T Eichorst, in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense counsel requests adjournment for status.
Court orders case adjourned for status in Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms

Defendant Orlando Santiago appeared by video, in custody in HOC.  Attorney Alexander J. Kostal appeared by video for Orlando Santiago.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective M. Bughman. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 28.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Orlando Santiago not in court, defendant in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests that the matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing or status; denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with LK (DOB: 4/8/2009)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant to post an additional $29,500: $500 previously posted on 6/5/22 to remain.   
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Level 5 Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.

Defendant Orlando Santiago in court with attorney Maryann Corea.  Defendant Orlando Santiago in custody.  Claire Louise Starling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Orlando Santiago appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
K WARRANT
